title.native: ふしぎ駄菓子屋 銭天堂

description:
Zenitendo is a mysterious candy store that only lucky people can reach. All the candy recommended by Beniko, the owner of the store, is perfectly suited to the buyer's troubles. However, it depends on whether the candy will be used or eaten correctly that it can bring happiness or misfortune.

(Source: MAL News)

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

title.native: 映画 ふしぎ駄菓子屋 銭天堂 つりたい焼き

node.description: Skilled in computer animation, he's the founder of animation studio Kanaban Graphics.

[Website](http://www17.plala.or.jp/reikohiroshima/)

**Date of Birth:** 1981

Reiko Hiroshima is a japanese novelist.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/katsuono)**

**Katsumi Ono** is a Japanese director, supervisor, episode director and storyboard artist.

Currently freelance. Watanabe started his career as an animator at Tsuchida Production, which he left in July 1986 after the studio's bankruptcy. He then joined Studio Gallop, where he was responsible for the character designs and chief animation direction for the studio's mahou shoujo titles such as [Hime-chan no Ribbon](https://anilist.co/anime/2037/), which was his debut as a character designer, [Akazukin Chacha](https://anilist.co/anime/103/) and [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/) as well as the hit TV anime series [Kodomo no Omocha](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/).

Frequent collaborator with [Akitarou Daichi](https://anilist.co/staff/100640/).

He then joined Studio Gallop, where he was responsible for the character designs and chief animation direction for the studio's mahou shoujo titles such as [Hime-chan no Ribbon](https://anilist.co/anime/2037/), which was his debut as a character designer, [Akazukin Chacha](https://anilist.co/anime/103/) and [Nurse Angel Ririka SOS](https://anilist.co/anime/616/) as well as the hit TV anime series [Kodomo no Omocha](https://anilist.co/anime/1486/).

Frequent collaborator with [Akitarou Daichi](https://anilist.co/staff/100640/).
Masato Yokoi is a color designer.
